entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 10:50PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Le Sueur, eastern Sibley, western Scott and Carver Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1050 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glencoe to near Green Isle to near Kasota. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 13 at 12:31PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT FRIDAY... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Quality Advisory for eastern Douglas and southern Lake counties, which is in effect until Friday afternoon. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecast conditions will cause air quality levels to fluctuate and could be at unhealthy

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 11:58AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COOL AND WET FALL-LIKE WEATHER WILL ARRIVE LATER THIS WEEK... The weather pattern will change later this week as a series of strong, wet cold fronts will bring an end to this long dry and hot summer. Overnight temperatures will cool into the lower to middle 40s Wednesday night, with some of our more exposed and traditionally

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 11:58AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COOL AND WET FALL-LIKE WEATHER WILL ARRIVE LATER THIS WEEK... The weather pattern will change later this week as a series of strong, wet cold fronts will bring an end to this long dry and hot summer. Overnight temperatures will cool into the lower to middle 40s Wednesday night, with some of our more exposed and traditionally

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 9:48PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Crook County through 1015 PM MDT... At 947 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Rozet, or 22 miles northeast of Gillette, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
